help-file.title: CASTER
help-file.content:
"Caster" is a term that is used to described "Magic-User" and "Priest" classes. It is used in referring to classes that are highly adept in the magical arts and who focus their studies solely on these crafts. Casters include Clerics, Conjurers, Warlocks, Ethermancers, Druids, Necromancers, Shamans, Psionicists, Illusionists and Sorcerers. Casters receive no penalties to their casting abilities.
The term "Semi-Caster" denotes an entirely different set of classes who, while not being as proficient in the magical arts, do dabble in the mystic areas. Because they do not devote their lives to the practice of magic, they have special hindrances. While being able to use many of the same spells as casters, semi-casters can only hold half the number of spells in their repertoire that a caster of same level can. In addition, because they are not as trained in magic, they find it a bit more difficult to memorize their incantations and to call on their deities for divine powers. Hence, semi-casters must take a little additional time in preparing their magic. Semi-casters include Anti-Paladins, Paladins, Rangers, Reaver, Bards and Unholy-Pipers.
